case_title: AMJAD ALI vs Haji MANZOOR HUSSAIN

contentions: Respondent resides abroad and cannot be appointed as Lambardar.
Respondent acted as Lambardar without formal appointment.
Petitioner is young, matriculate, and qualified for the position.
Petitioner does not belong to Village Khatana.
Petitioner owns less than five acres of land, making him ineligible.
Petitioner manipulated reports in his favor.
67 villagers submitted affidavits supporting the respondent.

statutory_provisions: Section 36 of The Land Revenue Act, 1967
Rules 16 and 17 of the West Pakistan Land Revenue Rules, 1968
key_findings: Personal influence, character, ability, and freedom from indebtedness are mandatory for Lambardar appointment.
The Additional District Collector did not follow mandatory provisions and instructions.

directions: Fresh applications for Lambardar appointment to be called.
District Collector to follow due process and statutory provisions.
importance_of_position: Lambardar plays a crucial role in rural society.
Appointment must be based on merit and free from external pressures.
